@emilymfg @ucddublin @LSEGeography @lsehistory @oxfordirishsem @CamHistory @ManchesterUP @TCDHistHum @nuigalway @UCC @QUB_History From Frank Gallagher's 1957 'The Indivisible Island: The History of the Partition of Ireland'. Book was govt funded and, from what I can gather, was widely circulated both in Ireland and US as part of anti-partition initiatives of the day. Scan's from my grandparents' copy. https://t.co/W0PFqhEaRs

So there you have it. Mystery solved. 👽 #MacNeillsMeaningofLife

a development from the inanimate existence of the earth, as it were automatically; a peculiar coincidence of matter and energy, producing life; a chance immigration of some germ of life from another planet or even from outside of the solar system. [ends] #MacNeillsMeaningofLife

... and problems, and which refuses to recognise that their mysteries are explained and their problems solved by learned generations. [scribble – deleted] For the beginning of [deleted word] life of earth, various ways may be considered possible: ... #MacNeillsMeaningofLife

LA1/P/130 This digression has not been out of proportion if it has succeeded to any notable degree in fostering the attitude of mind which recognises that the most familiar things may hold for us, even on the very surface, the most profound mysteries.. #MacNeillsMeaningofLife
But it also opens up the idea that Eoin MacNeill was open to the idea of aliens 👽 #MacNeillsMeaningofLife
I can’t promise it’s going to solve the question of existence #macneillsmeaningoflife
@ucdarchives Well, would you like to know what the page said? #MacNeillsMeaningofLife
